content.question: Which of the following best describes the author’s characterization of Baker’s perspective on the Black Freedom movement?

choices.label: Activism is most effective when oppressed societal groups form alliances and implement change from the top down.
Change can only happen when leaders focus on solving the problems of African Americans before trying to solve other problems.
Activism requires exploiting flaws and forcing political leaders to advocate for fair treatment of African American citizens.
Change involves correcting a set of societal problems that could limit people’s ability to participate as equal citizens.

content.answer: Change involves correcting a set of societal problems that could limit people’s ability to participate as equal citizens.
